website_summaries.verdict: While the top door is incredibly convenient for loading reluctant cats into the carrier, its attachment bolts do not secure well, leading to numerous reports of door failure and dropped carriers. That’s not good news for owners of heavier cats or traumatized animals. The carrier’s sturdy construction doesn’t make up for a poorly designed top door.
pros: Two-door access is almost a must for cat carriers, and this one offers left or right side open options as well
Reinforcement screws are included with the product and can make the carrier even more sturdy
cons: Not airline approved, as is the case with most top-loading carriers
Reports of the top handle or door popping open when carrying pets above 12 pounds

At least one user said the toggle bolts holding the top door seemed to be barely holding in place, and other users reported top door failure when carrying, which won’t make your cat love you much more

customer_reviews.title: Top Lid is Not Secure!
customer_reviews.text: The actual material is good and the two halves fit together fine, but my issue is with the top lid. The latching mechanism does not stay closed - there is a design tolerance issue with the engagement of the locking pin cylinder with its cut out. See the videos for more details. They have come undone with cat inside of the carrier before and I have had to hold the carrier from underneath to prevent the top lid from coming off. The top door needs to be redesigned.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Morilak

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I had the same experience as all the other one-star reviewers who stated that the top door was not secure. I used this to take my small, elderly, 9-lb cat to the vet, and the mechanisms that keep the top secure kept popping into the upright (non-secure) position whenever I would use the top handle, and the plastic would bend under the weight of the carrier. I was so afraid that the top would break off and that my cat would fall and escape that I ended up carrying the carrier in front of me like a box. If you're looking for a sturdy, convenient carrier that will keep your pet safe, look elsewhere. Bummer-- I generally love AmazonBasics products.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe Danner

customer_reviews.title: Top loader is not secure for holding and transit
customer_reviews.text: Great concept, poor design. We assembled as instructed, fairly easy to put together and the bolts kept the unit in one piece. But during the first transport, carrying the item with the weight of an 11lb cat inside, the top came off in my husbands hands while crossing the street. the carrier fell to the street and the front door came open. luckily the cat stayed inside and traffic stopped. Not a good situation with an already stressed and hurt cat. We are disappointed in this product as we are starting to like and purchase more 'Amazon Basics' items.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if your cat weighs more than a feather!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these carriers for my two young kittens. They are still growing and when I had to take them to the vet I discovered that while the case may have a secure design the top door with the handle has no security. I went to pick up the case to carry to kitten out the door and the lid popped open! Luckily I had only just lifted up the cage so my kitten was not harmed but I am now stuck with two carriers which you can not carry!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON’T BUY THIS CARRIER!!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this item one star on;y because there was not a lower rating! This is a pure unadulterated piece of garbage. The cutout in the top door on one side to allow the locking mechanism to seat was not wide enough. I had to file the plastic material to provide enough clearance to allow the bar of the locking mechanism to seat at all. I find it difficult to believe that were we to use the top door that our feline friend would not be long gone before we succeeded in resecuring the door. DON’T BUY THIS CARRIER!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nycha Schlegel

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: These are not sturdy enough. The latch that keeps the top on is weak and fail easily with my 18 lb cat. I bought 2, one for each 18 lb cat, and one was broken right away, and I don't have much faith in the other. They were also a pain to put together, very difficult to line up the holes so the screws could actually go through. Note that these are not TSA compliant.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy Tissue

customer_reviews.title: Not Safe
customer_reviews.text: Top lid and handle pop open when carrier is lifted.This could cause pet to get injured or lost. I couldn't believe it, I went to move it and nothing on the inside, but top was closed and front door was closed and both locked and I went to move it and entire top lid was the only thing I had in my hand, the handle part and rest in the floor. To dangerous to carry anything in the carrier, I ordered the petmate one with two openings and what a difference. so different and so much better made. The Petmate cost more, but I this will last, I sure hope.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki & Chaz Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very badly engineered
customer_reviews.text: I am with a rescue and former models have been great. This is terrible. The hardware requires tools to assemble even that is difficult to do tightly because the access is bad. Put bolts in upside down because couldn't tighten otherwise. The top door doesn’t hinge, it has springs and pops out, so is not easy to use and impossible with one hand, which is how you handle getting an animal out the top. Sending it back. Very disappointed. Amazon who tested this?
customer_reviews.author: William C Poston

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the smaller size of this carrier for my kitten before his first vet appointment. You are required to bring them in a hard sided plastic carrier which significantly limited my options. I'm very disappointed in this carrier, however. First, its tiny. My little guy is only 5 months old and 4.5lbs and he can't stand up inside it. Second, the quality is not good. Haven't even used it yet and the plastic latches are showing stress after assembly. I would absolutely return the carrier if I had any other option. I highly recommend you spend a little more and get a bigger and nicer carrier that you will be able to use more than once.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Use at risk of losing your pet!
customer_reviews.text: Use at risk of losing your pet! DO NOT trust this carrier. Top is not secure. I have bought dozens of carriers in my cat rescue work. This one is not safe. You may get a good one and it's okay to use, but I will not risk buying another even though they are less expensive. The Petmate version does not have the problem this one has. I have six of the Petmate ones now. Never a problem.
customer_reviews.author: E. Bach

customer_reviews.title: Dimensions are deceiving
customer_reviews.text: My 12lb Siamese cat may have fit if it was really 19in but usable space is only 16 1/2in and that is stretching it.The rest of the 19in is taken up by the door and the connection around the middle. Tried to get him in it and he freaked being so small and cut me a bit so I cant very well return it after getting some blood on it so now here I sit with a useless carrier.If the usable dimensions were part of the description I never would have purchased!! Buyer beware and I hope this doesn't happen to anyone else.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great kennel, good price but...
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a size between the 19” and 23” because the 23” was way too big and 19” seems a bit tight but my dog doesn’t seem to mind. The assembly is very easy. I made this purchase because I love the top loading option. My dog can barely turn around inside after she walks in through the regular door in the 19” and loading her through the top is tight too but she was slipping and sliding around in the 23” so we kept the smaller size. It’s nice to be able to open the top to let my dog stretch out her legs on long rides. You can remove the top completely also.
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: flimsy and cheaply made; not solid at all.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon needs a return menu choice of "Don't like it," or "Unhappy with item." This pet carrier is flimsy and cheaply made; not solid at all. The top and bottom can next together for storage, but the quick-lock connectors are negated by it needing to be reinforced with nuts and bolts that you will need screw together with each use and keep track of in-between. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Dominopersson

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for Traveling with Guinea Pig
customer_reviews.text: We had a road trip and my daughter's pet guinea pig joined us. He never weeped or squealed which is a good sign. He had space for a small bowl of food (hay, vegetables and pellets), and we attached his water bottle to the front door of the cage. The fact that the top opens helped a lot when it came to us getting settled into our hotel. She just had to open it, and place in in the portable play pen that we had for him. Then she removed the front door so that he could have a "hut" to sleep in. Overall, it is a great buy and her guinea pig likes to travel now.
customer_reviews.author: Epiphany

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, flimsy, dangerous for pets
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and flimsy. With a 14lb cat in there, the top bows and flexes so badly that the top-loading lid can pop open. Even without a cat in, the top will not lock shut. When assembling, the screw holes did not line up and had to be cut out more. Would not recommend at all.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Smaller than expected.
customer_reviews.text: It is solid enough. The top load door is convenient. However, its nominal dimensions match a straight-walled crate that we have. Although the outermost dimensions are almost the same, by the time one accounts for the seam around the middle and the curved walls, it is probably 15% smaller. The usable interior dimensions are roughly 16"L x 9"W x 9"H, rather than "19x12x10".
customer_reviews.author: fd-m

customer_reviews.title: I always recommend a top-opening crate
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little pet carrier. I bought the 23inch for my cat. It's on the larger end of cat-sized crates, as I wanted her to have a little extra room when traveling. I work at a humane society and can tell you from experience that top-opening crates are the best. For pets that are nervous at the vet's office or hesitant to come out of the crate, lifting them from the top is significantly less stressful than trying to pull them out the front. The 23inch size is most appropriate for medium-large cats and small breed dogs. For dogs, I would not recommend larger than 10lbs, as they tend to have less maneuverability than cats.
customer_reviews.author: DCW

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Have only used this once so far, but the top has stayed completely secure and made loading a particularly difficult cat to get into a carrier MUCH easier. Needless to say she still wasn't happy about it, but I had no issues getting the top locked securely, and carrying her by the handle in it. No signs of it opening by accident, seems pretty sturdy. Not something I need often, but worth every penny for the added space and the convenience of the top door. Perhaps it wouldn't feel as sturdy if it were used on an animal that was closer to the weight limit, but for her it is perfect. Thank you for the fast delivery and good product.
customer_reviews.author: Gina DeFilippo

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: The top-open feature is great for those who have panicky cats, but the overall design is not good. My cat weighs only 14lbs and the spring-loaded mechanisms that secure the top pop open when I lift the carrier with him in it. Very unsafe!! I now have to carry it from the bottom, like you would a box of something.
customer_reviews.author: Jean E.

customer_reviews.title: Getting my cat acclimated
customer_reviews.text: It was reasonably easy to assemble. At first I thought I wouldn't even need the provided screws, and just use the clips. However, my cat (14.9 lbs) might prove too fiesty, so I decided to use the screws. I love the way the crate opens from the top, as well as having a door, hoping that will make it easier to stuff him in for his infrequent trips to the vet. We'll see!! I assembled it, then set it on the floor so he could get used to seeing it and being around it, hoping that will make it less traumatic when it comes time. I will update later and let y'all know!!
customer_reviews.author: LacelleTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! Top door opens unexpectedly!
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, plenty of space for our large cat. The design flaw is the top door. Works perfectly for loading and unloading, but the handle is attached to the door and tends to open up when you pick the carrier up with the animal inside, sending your pet crashing to the ground. My cat is 13lbs. This should not have happened according to the recommended weight. Fortunately I caught the carrier before it hit the ground. It was easy to put together and the top door is a plus for reluctant creatures.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Thin and very flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: Other carriers this size say 15 pound limit. This says 25 pounds!!! I have three other carriers different names different sizes. The durability of this one is not even close. The top door has very flimsy latches on top of this. I would not put anything at all over ten pounds inside and then I would be scared of it falling apart! I normally like Amazon Basics but they went way too cheap with this item. Spend a few more dollars and get a name brand item! If all you want is a box and do not care about your pet then by all means buy two or three of these!
customer_reviews.author: WKF

customer_reviews.title: What you need to know!
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this carrier but the thinness of the plastic is not so convincing. Not so sure that it will hold my cat without busting open. It seems like the plastic is not study enough for my cat that weighs about 11 pounds. I bought it because it was going to be delivered in 2 days well it took about 7 days to get. The design I love that the top opens to get the cat out easier and it clips on the sides for extra safety, But I’m still not convinced that it’s not safe for any heavy animal being carried in this cage.
customer_reviews.author: Save On Products

customer_reviews.title: Handy Top Door
customer_reviews.text: The feature distinguishing this from other cat carriers is the top door. It is spring-loaded, and as secure as the regular door. The benefits are that you can more easily load your animal into the carrier than from the front door. And, if you are driving you pet to the vets, you can open the top door and keep your pet from freaking out. I use this for a large (OK, fat) cat. The top and bottom halves are secured with nuts and bolts, supplied, rather than cheaper fasteners.
customer_reviews.author: GrogMeister

customer_reviews.title: Great product, Fixed design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I like how this carrier came with screws to really secure the top and bottom parts of the carrier together. I also really like the top door which is the main reason I got it. My cat will easily walk into the carrier but it nice to have the option to open the top door so she can get some fresh air or see what’s going on around her. The only thing I don’t like is that the front door is heavy but that’s to be a given since it houses the springs for the door latch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The top opening is useless.
customer_reviews.text: The top loading feature is unusable. First, you can't have fingernails because you have to get under and pull out little plastic pins and that's not possible with fingernails. Second, even if you have no nails, this procedure is next to impossible to do, even for my husband who is uber-handy. Third, there is no hinge so if the cat is inside, the lid falls in on top of his head.
customer_reviews.author: L. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Good quality & has multiple uses for our dog.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an anxiety kennel for my little dog. She’s terrified to travel in a car. Although it didn’t help her car phobia, it’s perfect to comfort her in strange places(hotels) not to mention being smaller than her everyday kennel, it’s much easier to travel with. The top loading makes it easier to get her inside if she’s being stubborn & won’t go in by herself.(It’s rare, usually she loves going inside her kennels to relax & curl up, but nice not to push her through the small door when she’s not feeling it). Easy to assemble, easy to clean, light weight.
customer_reviews.author: JMVJMV

customer_reviews.title: Nice Feature
customer_reviews.text: I really like that the top of this kennel opens! Most of these type kennels only open in the front, which can sometimes make it harder to get your pet into the kennel. Opening the top and putting your pet into the kennel from the top works great! The way the top opens will take a little getting used too since it is kind of confusing at first. The top can be opened from left or right sides and can be completely removed as well. The rest of the construction seems to be pretty good quality. I would recommend this kennel to anyone who needs a kennel for their small dog or cat. Would make a great travel carrier too!
customer_reviews.author: Father

customer_reviews.title: Nice cost efficient product
customer_reviews.text: Nice crate for the money. Using it for pups safety when I cannot be eyes 👀 on every second. Helps in potty training for short periods. Pup is not carried in it so I have no issue with the locks/handle some reviewers mentioned. It’s inexpensive and works for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Zoe's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great, classic kennel
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to assemble and use. During long car trips with our two dwarf rabbits, we take the top off for them to poke their heads out. Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jared

customer_reviews.title: I just don't trust the handle/lid!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two, and with my two heaviest cats, of 14 pounds, I just do not trust the handle/lid. However, I opted to keep them. But, I carry them from underneath, with both hands/arms. Inconvenient! I have to make two trips to the car, both ways, at home and the vet, which in this case, is no less than once a month for those two cats. That is not a true complaint, since I opted to keep them. Other than that, they seem to be sturdy enough for normal use, with cats, IMHO, of not more than 10 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Gar

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat! Except one thing...
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of having two options of loading my kitty (top and side). BUT, the top does not have a hinge and it is not easy to put back in. How am I going to stuff my mean Siamese kitty in there and get the top on before she hops back out? That needs to be redesigned so there's a hinge on one side of the top door and also a way for it to stay up while loading your pet in from the top. How many of you out there have a cat that just LOVES to be stuffed into a carrier??
customer_reviews.author: Princess

customer_reviews.title: Very Unsafe!!!
customer_reviews.text: Product defective & very unsafe. Do not buy! Top loading door latches do not stay in place when you put your pet in the carrier. I placed my 13lb. cat in here to take to the vet & the top load door detached from the pet carrier. The carrier & the cat crashed down onto the driveway. I don't think he was hurt, but he almost escaped. Every time I tried to lock the latches in place, they rotated out as soon as I lifted the carrier. Very poorly designed & unusable. Item was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Frugalshopper

customer_reviews.title: Almost lost cat using this
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't hold anywhere near the max weight capacity! The top lid buckled and the latch popped out--had I not had a second hand under the carrier, I'd have lost my precious cat! I'd highly recommend getting a carrier withOUT a top lid entry. Also, you'd definitely not want to use this for checking a pet in a plane for those inquiring--definitely not sturdy enough!
customer_reviews.author: Fur mom

customer_reviews.title: Great pet carrier
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is cool and functional enough that the staff at the vet's office comment on it every time. The top comes off easily with the side clips, which is handy if your pet is anxious, has mobility issues or is wearing the "cone of shame." I bought the fleece bed to go inside, and my kitty actually selects to sleep in the carrier by choice. If I leave the top off she will treat it as a bed. My friends got the larger size for their two kittens (to carry both at once) and also love it. Their kitties sleep inside by choice as well. I don't know how I would make this product is better.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D.

customer_reviews.title: Best carrier
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we've purchased this carrier. We had been borrowing a second carrier when we had to take both cats to the vet, but we love this one so much it was worth having two. The top load option is so great for cats that don't like carriers since it's so much easier to just drop them in. The larger size is very roomy. It's sturdy and we've never had a problem with it opening while carrying (our cats are 8 & 12 lbs). It was also approved by our vet as it is hard-sided, so safer for traveling in the event of an accident.
customer_reviews.author: L. Quadri

customer_reviews.title: Travel made easy
customer_reviews.text: I always have a fight getting my cats into the carrier because they know they are going to the vets. My younger cat she is more compliant but my older cat we have a chase around the house to get her in. But it is easier for me drop her in and close the top and when we reach the vet I am able to open the door and let me look out. Both of my cats are fairly large both weighing over 10 lbs. it just makes it a lot easier than me TRYING to put them into the cat carrier where I have to hold them down and close it really quick without them escaping.
customer_reviews.author: D. Penfield

customer_reviews.title: Nice size for adult cat
customer_reviews.text: I don’t need to use a pet carrier very often, but when I do have to take my cat to the vet, I need one with a top opening. Cats HATE to get into a carrier and this is the perfect size for my 11 pound cat. I have a cat bed that fits perfectly in the bottom if it so dhe does not slide around. It does have a slick bottom, so for a cat, you have to put sonething in it. I used a bed I bought on Amazon. I am pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K

customer_reviews.title: Great design, excellent crate for cats
customer_reviews.text: Excellent design and quality, I have been looking for crate like this one for long time, Finally I find it here, I always have problem put my cat in the crate and I don’t want to focus them inside and every time is a big project for me to put them in the crate , but this crate make it so easy every time. I Love this crate and I will only get this one if I have to buy crate next time.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Very nice with a minor nuance compared to previous similar designs.
customer_reviews.text: Unlike previous cat carrier of similar design, this one needs at least the two screw/nut assembly near the opening gate side of carrier. Else, the weight of the cat in carrier will pop the front gate off!!! Once the two screw/nuts are on, the carrier is secure enough. But was wary of the snap design. Unlike previous models of similar designs, this one is not as convenient for quick assembly and disassembly due to needing the two screw/nuts holding near both sides of gate. All in all, very spacious!!! And once done using, disassembled and stacked away for later use. Nice and neat.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Love the top opening feature!
customer_reviews.text: I love the top opening feature! When I use it for my small bunnies it works great, but when I use it for my large cat I support the bottom because I feel like there is strain on the top. It has never malfunctioned, but I just worry about the weight. It is super easy to get my pets out of because of the top opening.
customer_reviews.author: River

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a good price for a nice product. It isn’t the sturdiest but it also wasn’t that expensive so it’s certainly acceptable. Easy to put together. Love that the top opens as well. I bought this (the larger size) for my rabbit who is 7.5 pounds and it’s much easier getting him in and out through the top. I kept trying to decide if I should get the smaller size (19” I think) vs. the larger (23”). I ended up getting the bigger one but I probably would have been fine with the small one. I am able to put a decent size litter box in there with hay for my bunny and he has plenty of room.
customer_reviews.author: M. Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit I was worry to purchase this carrier because of some of the reviews, but I have not had a single problem with it. User error maybe? It’s so nice to be able to load our cats in through the top or the front, although we usually have to load them in through the top because they hate going to the vet! Our cats are almost 3, and aren’t super big cats, but we purchased two carriers for them to help them have a little more space and feel more comfortable on their way to the vet. So I wouldn’t recommend this carrier if you’re planning to stuff multiple cats in it, unless they’re kittens.
customer_reviews.author: BWilson

customer_reviews.title: Game-changer for loading wiley cats!
customer_reviews.text: I was getting ready to move with two cats who have given me trouble in the past with traditional carriers. I bought these about a month in advance so I could get the cats acclimated. On cats' moving day, I had both access points open, put a little catnip in the bottom, and waited for cat #1 to investigate. Once she was in, I closed both doors, holding one shut with my leg while I finagled the top one. Cat #2 was suspicious of my trickery but seemingly understood my words. I secured the front door and just dropped him in via the top door. Easy Peasy. TLDR; Worth every penny. 10/10 would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: A worthy investment for my cats' security
customer_reviews.text: The cases are easy to assemble, very roomy, and secure ways to transport pets. I ordered three (3), unfortunately one of my cats died suddenly before I got to use them. The only thing I didn't notice in the description was the maximum recommended weight per pet (20lbs) - the one that passed was easily over the limit and it probably wouldn't have done well for carrying although even as big as he was he did fit. I put a carpet mat in the floor of each for comfort. These are great cases and I would recommend them wholeheartedly.
customer_reviews.author: Chelle Cordero

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier
customer_reviews.text: Great cat or small dog carrier. Like the blue and grey colors. I also like the top opening too. If our cat was sick that would be a gentle way to put her in it. Our cat is 13lbs. And there is plenty of room to take her on a trip. She likes to play in it also. They must have fixed the top locking problem. There is no way this one will pop open.
customer_reviews.author: glendurnich

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: First, I never give perfect ratings because nothing is perfect. This pet carrier is better than I expected but exactly what I had hoped for. I am very pleased with the top opening since we have cats and one very large cat. I ordered this because we could not get him in the carrier we have. The top opening made getting him inside possible and easy. I like the extra security with the added pins to keep the carrier from coming apart if your pet is quite heavy, which our large cat is. This carrier is a win, win all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: J. Francisco

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts! TWICE!
customer_reviews.text: I could only give this carrier two stars because it would only be great if it came with the screws to hold it together. The sides have clamps that seem somewhat secure, but when I tote my cat I’m afraid it’s going to come apart. I’m not looking forward to chasing my cat, but I feel that’s in my future. Anyway, had all the parts been with the carrier, I would have given it 5 stars. Well, I had to return the first carrier without screws and they sent me a replacement. The replacement has the screws but is missing a clamp! Frustrated is an understatement.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: durable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to transport my new kitten to and from the vet. I used to have a faux leather carryign case with zippers, but he tore that apart on the way home from the shelter on our first drive. The instructions are a bit hard to manuver on your own - an extra pair of hands makes it a lot easier - but once put together it is very durable. My kitten currently weighs about 6 pounds and it holds him pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Divina Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous - Purchase PetSmart Version Instead
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have stated, the prongs which are supposed to hold the top door in place twist and come loose. I only ever carry this by the base, and am always afraid somebody else will try to pick it up by the handle, potentially letting my cat loose. I would recommend the PetSmart top door version instead. It is more expensive, but more secure.
customer_reviews.author: A. Loudenback

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: A starving, scraggly six week old kitten, near death, came crawling out of the woods to us one night two months ago and is very happy to spend safe, comfortable time in this carrier. Whether it's going to the vet, the groomer or just outside with us for a walk she is very content and so are we. Thank you for a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent carrier.
customer_reviews.text: Hi bought this carrier since the other one I had I realized was too small for my cat. Plus this one also opens from the top in case I need to get my cat into the carrier if he's resisting getting in. The only criticism I have of it is that when the cat is inside and I lift up the carrier, the weight of the cat causes the 2 tabs on top to pop up - instead of laying flat in the grooves. The top door stays completely closed, however, so it's not really a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Russo

customer_reviews.title: Very fine cat carrier!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cat carrier because I can't find cardboard carriers any more. This one opens from the top and short side. It is very well build. When my 12 lb. cat is inside, it is a bit heavy for me...I'm 78 yrs. old but my cat has plenty of room to turn around and it works just fine. It is also easy to clean. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a nice carrier for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice carrier for the price. We use it for our holland lop rabbit to visit the vet. It has easy access from the front or top. The top was puzzling to get open the first time but once you figure it out it is simple. Having both options to remove the bunny was nice after his surgery as we weren't sure how mobile he would be. The rabbit can move around and has plenty if ventilation but it's also solid enough and has privacy on the sides for a nervous animal. Glad I made this purchase, I'm sure it will get a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: D. Warren

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and cost
customer_reviews.text: Just recieved this crate and so far I'm very impressed with the quality considering how cheap it is. The latches that hold the crate together are way more sturdy than my old crate (which my dog was able to break out of several times) and they even have added nuts and bolts that you can use to screw the two halves together. The dog would have to break the crate to get out. The door latch also seems much sturdier. I haven't used the top door yet, but it doesn't seem like she'll be able to break through it. For a basic crate you can't beat this one in terms of quality or cost.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Quite disappointed
customer_reviews.text: First time use, picked it up with my 12 lb. cat inside, and the handled lid fell off. Tried again, and I dropped him again. The pet place tried to fix it, but couldn't. We will have to superglue it, because too much fuss to send it back. I got an inexpensive one because my cat is still growing, but this is insufficiently reliable. I have to carry it by the sides.
customer_reviews.author: Snookie

customer_reviews.title: Top load option is much better for pets!
customer_reviews.text: Good price! Plus this kennel has a top load option, which my cat prefers. I highly recommend a top load kennel for those with pets who put up a fight going in. I learned top load is the way to go when I had a rabbit and haven't looked back since. Having both choice is a must for me when buying a kennel. This kennel is good for a cat up to 15 lbs maybe? Or a small dog, such as a chihuaha
customer_reviews.author: HappyHomebody

customer_reviews.title: great for bunnies!
customer_reviews.text: I have two decent size rabbits ( English Angora and a lion head/Californian mix" both about 8lbs. They fit in this no problem even with a make shift hay feeder in the back. I had no issues with the top unlatching like many others have stated. The product itself is build well, everything fits together and only took about 5 minutes to bolt everything in place. There's no spaces where by bunnies can accidentally catch themselves and cause injury which is a huge must as they are smaller and easier to catch in air ventilation holes. I would highly recommend this products to all midsize rabbit owners.
customer_reviews.author: Cadey

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, easy to assemble, and fairly sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this kennel when we needed an inexpensive crate to transport 3 5 month old kittens to a spay and neuter clinic. They were a little cramped (two of the 3 came home in cardboard carriers post-speutering) but it did the job and they got there safe and sound. My only concern was I thought the door on the top was going to pop open when carrying the crate with less than 20 pounds in it. For a single small animal, or a couple of guinea pigs or small bunnies, this is great though! And the price was great too. Amazon branded products always make me happy!
customer_reviews.author: Deb W.

customer_reviews.title: ... use this for our new puppy and it’s been great. We like that it opens from the top ...
customer_reviews.text: We use this for our new puppy and it’s been great. We like that it opens from the top or from the front when opening from the front it is an easy one step operation you just squeeze together and the door opens easily. It did not come with the pad so we had to buy one separately. But it seems to be made really well. The screws were a little hard to put on but we realize we didn’t need all of them to put it together because there are clips that you just clamp down to attach the top to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe and durable
customer_reviews.text: This safely got my 14lb siamese cat across the country from Boston to Arizona with no troubles... well aside from Zeppelin singing me the songs of his people for 40 hours straight... But this carrier is great, just make it comfy with a blanket and you are good to go. Such a lifesaver because I could not afford to spend an extra 80$ on a carrier at petsmart
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pet Carrier
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pet carrier. You can get your pet in or out of the carrier three different ways: through the hinged wire door; through the top door where the carrying handle is; or remove the entire top-half of the carrier by unsnapping four locks that hold the top-half to the bottom-half of the carrier. The carrier is lightweight and airy. It is made mostly of plastic and seems to be durable. The wire screen door easily latches securely.... nice design. Fast service.... received it in two days.
customer_reviews.author: Michael T.

customer_reviews.title: A Well-Designed Carrier
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the carrier to take my cat to the vet and to have a small, easy-to-handle place to put him in case of emergency. I especially like that the top screws to the bottom and I don't have to worry about simple clips coming unclipped and my cat escaping. The shell of the carrier is very firm and robust. I also like the door in the top that is secure to lock. I'm very happy with this purchase and I would recommend this carrier to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: CLMCM

customer_reviews.title: Difficult build, terrible door mechanic
customer_reviews.text: Terrible clunky design. The product is cheaply made and flimsy. You have to build the cage yourself so you have to screw in some bolts on the side for it to hold together but the space to twist is too tight for me with a tool or with my fingers. And my hands are very small to begin with so securing it is nearly impossible. The top door is badly designed. You have to pull two separate pieces back that are on opposite sides of the cage so it’s hard to do with one hand. It’s just very insecure and poorly made. I don’t recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Kwon

customer_reviews.title: Pick a different carrier.
customer_reviews.text: This box feels very cheap. The top opening is very weak to stay closed. It's OK for my 5 pound kitten, but I won't use it for my 17 pound cat as I fear the top door would spring open. Not worth the money. Also top and bottom didn't line up well to put box together. Had to force it a bit.
customer_reviews.author: C. Armer

customer_reviews.title: Much more humane due to non-scary top entry.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. The top load is make it or break it - my poor rescue cat FREAKS THE **** OUT if I try to put him in the front door like hes about to be murdered. Ever tried to shove a cat in a box head first? Yeah, no. Blood ensues. Instead, get this box, and gently slip their little tush in the top while they are looking at you (lower them in) then put the lid down. This seems to be way less panic inducing. i also bruuuuuush him and give him treats so hes all doped up on natural oxytocin and feeling trusting before this possibly terrifying event takes place.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and great price
customer_reviews.text: I don’t understand the negative reviews stating it falls apart....I don’t think those people were locking it properly. You do have to make sure the top is latched the correct way before picking it up or it WILL come open. However, if locked in the right position I don’t see how it would come apart on its own. I definitely recommend the size up from the smallest size. My cat is pretty small and he fits perfectly in the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: LoveLeoCustomCrafts

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUT NOT SAFE!
customer_reviews.text: Would have given this a zero stars but it will not allow you to do so. This cat carrier cut my cats nose twice and her nose was bleeding badly. The top layer of her nose was hanging off. It was a three hour trip with no time to get new one. She had surgery and the ride was hard enough on her. The vet said stopping to get new one would have made her stressed out and is not safe for her to do so right now, to pat her nose with clean gauze. I had my son do this all the way home. DO NOT BUY NOT SAFE!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda DeArruda

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Well made sturdy carrier purchased for my cat. Easy to put together and very secure. Only complaint is that the instructions are in tiny print and the 9 short steps are on multiple pages, but the carrier is easy enough to figure out without instructions if necessary. Suggestion would be to put instructions in each language in its own block space ie. english on one page, chinese on another, french on another etc. I would definitely purchase this product again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I should have believed the reviews about the flimsy top. It does NOT latch securely, and is very cheaply made. After assembling it, I also realized that it takes two hands to drop a pet into the top, which is exactly what I wanted to avoid. So I threw it in the trash, and will search elsewhere for a suitable pet carrier. If this is the best that Amazon Basic can do, then shame on Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: david sorenson

customer_reviews.title: My Rabbit Loves and So Do I
customer_reviews.text: I use this to carry my rabbit on travels, and it's great. Good quality, perfect size, and great price. It opens in the front with a grate door or it can come off, the top roof can swing open or come off, and then the top half can separate. I actually leave the carrier in my rabbits enclosure and with the door off, it's my rabbit's little "house". When he is scared or tired he runs in there, so I can just make a loud noise, attach the door, and off we go!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little weak for heavy cats.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great carrier! Well made, good latches and additional bolts to make it wonderfully secure. I always love top entry carriers better. It’s the perfect size for larger cats, but unfortunately I’m way to scared to carry it by the handle with them in it because the top bows a bit. Basically they should have used stronger plastic on the lid or reinforced it a bit better. Instead we had to carry by the bottom, which wasn’t terrible for us as we were moving to our new house. But it would be a pain for someone needing this for a plane (idk if it’s tsa approved or not) or more active traveling, unless your pet is quite light.
customer_reviews.author: Ani

customer_reviews.title: Decent, affordable carrier
customer_reviews.text: I was a little unsure about the size but I put my 7lb-ish tabby and she fits fine, although she doesn’t have a ton of room. If you have a larger cat you might want to get the 23inch - i would’ve if there wasn’t such a cost differential. I bought this because I want an alternative to her soft carrier as she frequently makes a mess on the way to the vet (she panics during car rides). Now that I’ve assembled it, I think it is sturdy and will not fall apart. Amazon basics is the way to go on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Burton

customer_reviews.title: Works super well, cats love it
customer_reviews.text: The product comes in pieces and you need to assembly it. some of the screws are hard to get in, but use some elbow grease and it will be fine. We absolutely LOVE the size (longer one) (fit both of our 4month kittens - 5 and 4lbs). We leave it out all the time for them and they will even play in it along with their other toys. The top opening is a blessing and makes it so much easier to get the cats into the crate when it is time to travel to the vet. Would absolutely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Boss

customer_reviews.title: Not stable enough
customer_reviews.text: This product is very unstable and flimsy. I bought this because my cat is being neautered next week. I needed something spacious, which this bad boy is plenty spacious for a house cat. I am not convinced that this is stable enough. Just by putting about 5 pounds of hand pressure on the base of this product it is separating slightly from the top, which is an issue because my kitten is 10 pounds. I wouldn't rely on this for long distance trips with your kitty or rely on the handle. This could easily far apart and your cat could get out.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Renee

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to assemble and disassemble
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our four pound chihuahua who's getting up there in age and can't always hold it while we're gone working if you know what I mean. This has been an absolute dream though. It was easy to assemble, and whenever he does make a mess it's easy to take apart and clean. It's a pretty hard plastic so I wouldn't recommend it without a small bed or blanket. It does have little screws to put the top and bottom together if you plan on carrying it a lot. We've mostly used it as a kennel.
customer_reviews.author: Alaina K.

customer_reviews.title: Nice size, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Lots of space inside. I am currently using it for my two 4-month old kittens and there's plenty of extra space inside for them to grow into it. I put the 22-inch MidWest Deluxe Bolster Pet Bed inside and it fits like a glove. Assembly is pretty easy. I thought the top door would have stayed attached to the crate but it comes off. I think that has both it's positives and negatives, but it's really easy to put the cats in through the top door since it's a pretty big opening.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict0509

customer_reviews.title: Easy release doors
customer_reviews.text: I purchased specifically because it had top loading door AND an easy to remove top half. This does both. Be sure to watch the video to learn how to use the top loading door because it’s not intuitive. I think if you have a very heavy cat you might need to use the bolts that attach the upper and lower half. I’m going to try it without for my 15 pounder since sometimes it’s hard to load an uncooperative kitty through the top or side door of a carrier. The 23 inch is perfect for my 15 pound Maine coon and his big fluffy tail!
customer_reviews.author: Cat Pal

customer_reviews.title: Does its Job!
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly fine for the annual or bi-annual trip to the vet. No complaints. I especially like the top load component. It keeps me from having to forcefully shove a 24lb cat inside that has dagger-like claws. Y'all know that getting a cat into a carrier has to be done with finesse. I can pick him up and pretend we are having a loving moment and then quickly, yet gently, place him in the carrier from the top and even quicker attach the lid back. Luckily his vet is only a few miles away. :)
customer_reviews.author: TTSP0328

customer_reviews.title: Removable top is so much better than the oldschool units.
customer_reviews.text: Very cool removable top. It is so easy to get the cat into. I leave it around with the door open and top off and for whatever reason, the cat plays in it? The vet liked it too. Three happy customers with one purchase, can't beat that. My cat is only 6 months old so he fits in it fine. If you have a giant monster cat, this might be too small. My last cat was 21 pounds and would not have fit in it. Update: Since going to the vet. in it, all he wants to do is go for a ride, ROADTRIP???
customer_reviews.author: Jerry S.

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, I love this pet carrier. My granddaughter just got a bunny and needed something to put the bunny in when she's cleaning its cage. This carrier is awesome. Its sturdy, beautifully designed, I love how you can open from the side or the top. The top opening would make it so much easier to reach down to get your pet. Plenty of holes for ventilation.. you could add a strap if you wanted to. The price is right too!! What more could you ask for. It's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, great price
customer_reviews.text: This cat carrier was very easy to assemble and I consider it to be a high quality product. Fit and finish is excellent and the door latch works well and easy to operate. I have seen cat carriers at much higher prices that were not close to the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Aruba

customer_reviews.title: Very nice well-made carrier
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to put together and I'm sure the top loader part will come in handy for most pets. My cat gets crazy when put into any carrier, so getting her in there will be the usual drama - front or top loader. But having had many cats over the years, the top-loader part would have been handy. Anyway, this was easy to assembly and I'm sure my cat will scream like crazy, but she'll be in a good carrier. Glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Clutter Hater

customer_reviews.title: Best for Small Animals
customer_reviews.text: We love these boxes! It has great features, including both front and top loading, and it's easy to put together. We discovered, however, that our cats--who are 20" long (28" when including the length of their tails)--were too big and long for the small size box. I have since learned that a cat's travel box should be 1.5 times bigger than they are to provide plenty of room for them to stand and turn around comfortably. We will be reordering to get the next bigger size.
customer_reviews.author: Marie M.

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for. This is a ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is a far inferior carrier than the ~$42 name brand version. The plastic and and the top door hinge feel flimsy and the way the assembly is supposed to work with screws and nuts around the outside is impossible because of the way the plastic forms a lip where the top and bottom meet. If I had the chance to do it over again, I would spend the extra $20 and get the higher quality carrier, which is also a bit taller than this one. I will be driving my cat across the country in this carrier. I hope it holds up!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The carrier is very nice and the open top function is fantastic for taking ...
customer_reviews.text: The carrier is very nice and the open top function is fantastic for taking fussy pets in/out, or just letting in a little more light and air if need be. The kennel is very lightweight, making it ideal for short trips and car rides, but I do not think it is sturdy enough for plane or rough travel. I agree with the criticism that the top handle does feel a little flimsy, and would not trust it to support the weight of any animal >8-10lbs. Perfect for rabbits, guinea pigs, chinchillas, etc. but I would be hesitant to put a cat or small dog in.
customer_reviews.author: Emma S

customer_reviews.title: Lid color is off from advertised pic, but I still like the overall item
customer_reviews.text: Bought the 19” for my 5 month old kitten, who’s around 6 pounds as seen in pic, it’s perfect size for her and I think it’ll still be as good when she is fully grown as well. She likes to try and get out with carriers so I had to get her a kennel and it seems like it’s doing the job of keeping her in. The plastic and weight was a lot thinner and lighter than I had thought, so I think these are perfect for cats and small dogs only that aren’t too incredibly strong. Also, they have redesigned the latches, thank god, that opens and closes the top roof.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Very small and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 23”. The product description states the size to be “Measures 55 x 35 x 30 inches (LxWxH)”. The actual size, as measured on the outside, was around 22 x 12 x 13. It is tiny and flimsy and would only be good for a kitten. Also, the latch on the top door arrived broken and the front door could not be opened. I was very disappointed in this product, so I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Gori Suture

customer_reviews.title: Totally unsafe
customer_reviews.text: This popped open when my cat was in it and she got away. I managed to capture her (after much work and heartache), so you don't need to worry about that. At any rate, I bought two of these and I didn't use them for quite a while. I would like to return them but it is too late. I might as well have flushed the money because there is no way I would entrust another pet's safety to this product.
customer_reviews.author: kristin

customer_reviews.title: great for rabbits and other smaller pets
customer_reviews.text: Assembling this carrier was quick and easy. The 23-inch is great for my rabbit; he's medium-sized, and has plenty of room to turn and stretch out inside. A water bowl can fit in there with him as well. I haven't had an issue with the top door coming open, but I would still advise keeping an arm under it (and all other pet carriers for that matter), just as a precaution. I'd definitely recommend this carrier, it was worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our kitties!
customer_reviews.text: We have two cats and we needed a little carrier so we can take them to the vet and have check ups. It's a great size and is light and easy to transport. It's got enough holes to where the kitties can look around and feel safe, and small enough we can buckle it into the car. Just a cute little carrier all around.
customer_reviews.author: Krugs

customer_reviews.title: What are the function of the screws and snap-latches?
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made pet-travel case, but why does the manufacturer supply screws and nuts to secure the cage top and bottom together. The screws totally negate the need for the four snap latches that can also hold the top an bottom of the cage together. Aside from that issue this is a well made and cost effective product that is worth getting for small pets.
customer_reviews.author: hasenmaus

customer_reviews.title: Great for anxious dogs
customer_reviews.text: purchased for daughter’s dog who deals with high level of separation anxiety... they had a wire cage but it was not helping... peanut(dog’s name) was nervous at first but got use to it quickly... my daughter even told her to go lay down... not expecting her to go into carrier but she did... they say she prefers the carrier over just floor cushion! Have had no issues w/it popping open ... they leave it open from time to time. If you have a high stress type dog... I recommend this one
customer_reviews.author: Happy Mom

customer_reviews.title: but it seems sturdy. It is a nice large size for a ...
customer_reviews.text: A little tougher to put together than I hoped, but it seems sturdy. It is a nice large size for a long trip. I wish the holes were bigger for my cat to see out of and I wish the floor were textured so it wasn't so slippery. The top door is a little confusing but it seems sturdy, but I wouldn't hold it by the handle. This was my first time buying a cat crate so I didn't really know what features to look for. This one is fine, but if it breaks somehow I will not buy the same model.
customer_reviews.author: Lucia Anne Kalinosky

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made, unsafe unit. The top can come loose while carrying and unit would be dropped possibly injuring animal. Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.author: cattgirl

customer_reviews.title: quality product
customer_reviews.text: my dog gets through so many other crates but so far in a few months he has not gotten out of this one. When We travel with him we take the crate apart, nest the pieces and put his bed in it and he is comfortable. He wears a special harness that is tethered to a seat belt clip and the crate does not impede tethering him in for safety in the car.
customer_reviews.author: HONEST REVIEWER

customer_reviews.title: Best crate out there for cats
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this crate for about a year and it looks almost new. It has held up wonderfully and is a great size. I purchased the 23 inch size for my cat and it is plenty big enough. She is a 9 lb cat and it provides tons of room for her to sprawl out. You could probably fit a cat twice her size in this crate and it would still be big enough. I use this to transport foster kittens as well and I’m really grateful that it opens from the top because it makes getting them out a million times easier. I can’t recommend this crate enough!
customer_reviews.author: Janis Horton

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: The top of the carrier kept popping off when I carried it from the top handle. I had to carry it from the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A Top-Notch Carrier For A Small Pet
customer_reviews.text: This pet carrier has all the great features, is a snap to put together and comfortably fits a small to medium sized (up to 11 pounds) cat or a very small dog. It works well for things like trips to the veterinarian, but I would not recommend it for extended travel or an airplane because it is not roomy enough. Still and all, the price is more than competitive and the carrier is well made. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great pet carrier!
customer_reviews.text: It fits together very nicely, but the two stabilizing screws on the back are NOT enough. I drilled holes for additional screws just behind the two front latches for additional security, so that there was no chance it would accidentally pop open. That may not be a problem since it seems pretty secure, but I'd rather be safe than sorry. I love the smaller ventilation holes in it because it's better for transporting small parrots.
customer_reviews.author: MC

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics Two-Door Top-Load Hard-Sided Pet Travel Carrier
feature_bullets: Two-door, top-load model allows for easy loading of your cat or dog
Top door can open to the left or right for easy access and convenience
Included screws can be used to further secure the top and bottom of kennel for added reinforcement
Made of durable plastic with a steel-wire front door
Recommended for small breeds such as Boston Terriers and Beagles (12 - 25 lbs)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
